title: [Large-Scale] Blended Social-Medical Integrated e-Learning Course for Strengthening Chronic Non-Cancer Pain Management Expertise: Citizen Rights Promotion and Community Support System Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge, clinical experience, patient-provider communication skills, understanding of social determinants of health (SDOH), experience linking community resources, and awareness of patient rights advocacy cases
context.additional_context: A blended course conducted in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments, combining online learning modules (medical knowledge) with offline case discussions (social context analysis and strategies to overcome systemic barriers). It includes case studies on community resource linkage (welfare services, self-help groups) and patient rights enhancement (ensuring medical accessibility, prohibiting discrimination).

learning_goals: Learners can explain 20 or more core competencies in chronic non-cancer pain management (integrating medical and social approaches) and propose patient-healthcare provider relationship improvement strategies from a civic engagement perspective.

Learners can apply two or more pain management approaches (pharmacological/non-pharmacological treatments) in actual clinical settings after training and establish plans for linking patients' social support systems (community resource connections, economic support measures).
Learners can present institutional improvement-level evidence (medical utility, cost-effectiveness, socioeconomic impact) to actively recommend the training course to peer medical professionals.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
